Comprehensive taxonomic overview of the fresh and brackish water molluscs of West African ecoregions and compiled up to date biodiversity checklist.

View
High genetic variation in mitochondrial DNA: characterisation and implications in evolutionary biology
Project
The marine gastropod Melarhaphe neritoides is used as model organism to answer the following questions of the project: What is a very high amount of genetic variation (called hyperdiversity) in mtDNA? How common is it across phyla? In which extent the mutation rate, natural selection and the effective population size explain this high genetic variation? How can high amounts of genetic variation mislead researchers in interpreting population genetic differentiation? Do high mitochondrial variation and high mitochondrial mutation rates have implications for mitogenome architecture and evolution?
